address: No. 221, Sec 2, Zhi Shan Rd, Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
label: 觀光
review: This place is valuable for everyone who's love the Taiwan's history and culture. I love this place so much.

address: No. 101 Jihe Road, Shilin District, Taipei City
label: 餐飲
review: dont forget to visit here when you travel to Taipei, it is a famous night market in Taipei. there are many food courts and fried chicken is one of delicious things

address: No. 21, Zhongshan South Road, Zhongzheng District, Taipei City
label: 觀光
review: Came here in the late afternoon so it was cooler but the sky was just beautiful with such a large landscape of garden plots and sight of memorial hall. The contrast of white building against the blue sky was perfect for photography. Watch the flag lowering at CKS.

address: 89th Floor, No. 7, Section 5, Xinyi Road, Xinyi District, Taipei City
label: 觀光
review: The second time I came to Taipei 101 Building, there are still so many tourists. This is one of the classic attractions that must be played in Taipei. No matter whether you think it is interesting or not, you have to check in. The surrounding business districts are also good.

address: No. 211, Guangzhou St, Wanhua District, Taipei City, Taiwan 10853
label: 觀光
review: Visiting Longshan Temple in Taiwan offers a rich cultural experience. The temple, dating back to 1738, showcases intricate architecture, vibrant religious rituals, and a serene atmosphere. Explore the ornate decorations, witness traditional ceremonies, and immerse yourself in the local history and spirituality. Don't forget to respect the customs and take in the unique blend of Buddhist, Taoist, and folk religious elements at this iconic site.

address: Raohe St, Songshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 105
label: 餐飲
review: Raohe night market. one the well known night market in Taipei. among the best. lots of food. not cheap tho. do come here to taste the street food of Taipei. This place is well connected with the metro station.

address: Lane 173, Kangding Rd, Wanhua District, Taipei City, Taiwan 108
label: 觀光
review: Peeled scorpion - The settlement formed in the early Qing Dynasty ． spanning the three eras of Qing Dynasty, Japanese rule and Republic of China, mixing architectural styles and humanistic features of different periods, and becoming a city street that represents the characteristics of scorpion. In 2009, the renovated "Peeled Historical District" was completed, standing in the lanes of Wanhua District, Taipei City today, continuing the historical trajectory of more than 100 years: the red and brown brick walls of arched pavilion feet, surrounded by the ancient atmosphere. part 2
